tests.name: `zip` iterates its collection arguments in the same time, as many times as there are elements in the longest collection.
tests.template: {{# zip(hair, names, ages) }}{{ name }} ({{ o }}) is {{ age }} years old and has {{ hair}} hair. {{/ }}
tests.expected: Alice (a) is 30 years old and has brown hair. Bob (a) is 25 years old and has silver hair. Craig (n) is  years old and has dark hair.

tests.name: `zip` iterates its collection arguments in the same time, as many times as there are elements in the longest collection.
tests.template: {{# zip(ages, names, hair) }}{{ name }} ({{ o }}) is {{ age }} years old and has {{ hair}} hair. {{/ }}
tests.expected: Alice (h) is 30 years old and has brown hair. Bob (h) is 25 years old and has silver hair. Craig (h) is  years old and has dark hair.

tests.name: `zip` renders an error when provided with something else than a collection.
tests.expected_error: zip filter.*requires all its arguments to be enumerable

tests.name: `zip` preserves the boolean value of empty arrays.
`each` filter iterates its array argument and make the @first and @index keys available for rendering.
`each` filter does not render for empty arrays.
`each` filter iterates its dictionary argument and make the @first and @key keys available for rendering.
`each` filter does not render for empty dictionaries.
